intro: Sida macrostipula, commonly known as the long-stipitate sida, is a flowering plant species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have hairy surfaces. Sida macrostipula is typically found in open areas such as fields and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
